result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

[MA]Cases 16CF415,15CM182 and 17CM13 called together at 3:56pm
Defendant Bridget C. Griep in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; 
Pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 16CF415
Factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Case 17CM13 & 15CM182

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Griep

As to Case 16CF415, Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year.
As to Case 16CF415, Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.

Conditions of Probation:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent
--provide DNA sample 
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay officer overtime fees in the amount of $153.21 to Watertown PD
--restitution in the amount of $168.44 payable to Pick N Save--joint and several

Days credit for time already served:  49  days as to each count 
recess: 4:25pm

[MA]Case called at 3:00pm
Defendant Bridget C. Griep in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon inquiry of the Court, DA Happ indicates preparedness for Trial; Atty. De La Rosa indicates ready as well

Atty De La Rosa notes the possibility of a stipulation as to the substance in question, therefore alleviating the need for expert witness.

DA Happ indicates that the State had previously filed pretrial motions; the Court notes that the motions were already addressed

The Court informs Ms. Griep that for purposes of trial she has 7 prior convictions

recess: 3:10pm

Cases 15CM182 and 16CF415 called together at 2:27pm [ma]
Defendant Bridget C. Griep in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek on behalf of attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance in both cases.

Ms. Griep waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Cases 15CM182 and 16CF415 called together at 1:44pm
Defendant Bridget C. Griep appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case 16CF415:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Defense requests a Speedy Preliminary Hearing

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

As to Case 16CF415: The Court requires an additional $750 cash bond with non monetary conditions:
--no presence at Pick N Save in Watertown
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, to include needles without a valid prescription

As to Case 15CM182: The Court requires an additional $750 cash bond, with non monetary conditions to continue.
recess 1:52  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing (16CF415)/STC(15CM182) on 12/19/16 at 230pm [time limits apply]

[MK] cases #15CM182 and #16CF415 called at 11:01am. 
Defendant Bridget C. Griep not in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case #15CM182: 
--ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
--After reviewing the bail-forfeiture notices mailed to the Defendant and to the Surety, the Court finds that the final order of forfeiture is appropriate; the clerk should tender the cash bail to the County's General Fund. 

As to Case #16CF415:
--The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.  
--The Court issues a body-only Probable Cause Warrant.  
recess 11:03am.

Case called at 1:13pm [mo]
[Return on Warrant]
Defendant Bridget C. Griep in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

The Court reviews the Court Record
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Ms. Griep's address remains current

The Court notes it has previously reviewed the Motion to Dismiss
--the Court indicates it continues to NOT be persuaded by the Motion; gives basis
--the Court declines to dismiss the action or find that the Complaint is defective


Atty. Svehlek indicates that she has no knowledge of the Motion and the arguments intended to be given by Atty. De La Rosa, requests bond be set and a future Motion hearing be scheduled
The Court indicates that the Defense may file a Motion for Reconsideration

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with non-monetary conditions:
--stay in regular and constant contact with Counsel
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--not to possess or consume any prescription medications without having in reach a prescription establishing that she has a prescription for the prescription medication she has consumed/ possesses.

The Court scheduled this case for FSSC and Jury Trial
The Court distributes its scheduling order.
recess: 1:36pm

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 6/6/16 at 1:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 6/9/16 at 8:30am

Case called at 2:35pm [mo]
Defendant Bridget C. Griep appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court reviews the Court Record which indicates that Ms. Griep has not yet been appointed counsel.
The Court inquires of Attorney De La Rosa, who is present in the courtroom on another matter. 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that he is willing to go meet with Ms. Griep now, so long as that is approved by the jail.
The Jail approves Atty. De La Rosa meeting with Ms. Griep now. 
recess: 2:52pm--reconvene:3:08pm [to allow Atty. De La Rosa to meet with Ms. Griep regarding eligibility for PD representation]

Defendant Bridget C. Griep appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Ms. Griep does qualify for PD representation and that he will assign himself to her case.

Adjourned Initial Appearance occurs:

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered.
recess: 3:12pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/16/15 at 10:00am     (2)  Status Conference on 9/29/15 at 8:30am
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-03-2015 02:30 pm

[MK] case called at 2:50pm. 
Defendant Bridget C. Griep appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Based on the responses Ms. Griep gives to the Court's inquiries, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Today's hearing is scheduled as an Adjourned Initial Appearance, however Ms. Griep does not have counsel. 
Ms. Griep indicates that she has put in a request-slip twice, through jail staff, for the Public Defenders Office to meet with her, however she has not heard from them.
ADA Hall indicates that she will email the Jefferson Public Defenders Office to alert that them that Ms. Griep needs an evaluation for eligibility determination. 
The Court directs Ms. Griep to submit, through jail staff, another request to meet with PD. 
recess 2:52pm. 


NEXT: schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance at least one week out to allow time for Ms. Griep to meet in the Jail with PD staff
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-21-2015 02:00 pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:14 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Bridget C. Griep appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
DOB & address confirmed accurate; Miss Griep informs the Court that she has not received a copy of the complaint
Court informs Miss Griep that it will have jail staff get copy of complaint to her and then recall matter
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Recess: 2:19 pm Reconvene: 2:38 pm
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Service of the complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; Miss Griep indicates that jail can be used as alternate address; charge/penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Count #1
Miss Griep indicates that she would like counsel before proceeding
Court adjourns initial appearance

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with no special conditions: 
Recess: 2:44 pm
